title: Drawing, July 1844
inscribed:
Recto: Inscribed in graphite, at upper right:  July 1844.

Verso: Inscribed in graphite, at top: Dark purple edged with gold and red at the bottom each...?... / The sky a beautiful green  The lowest - towards the south snuff color. / The most beautiful sunset that / ever was seen Nov. 1844.; again numbered, at various locations indicating: "1 Thus / 2 much broken thus / 3 thus (red); and again, along bottom: blue, brandy color, green, yellow.
dimensions: Mat: 40.6 x 55.9 cm (16 x 22 in.); 1/2 in depth
description:
Recto:Horizontal view of the Catskill Mountain House seen from the side, slightly below, with trees and bushes in the foreground.
Verso: Horizontal view of hill profile of the Catskill Mountains with cloud effects.

exhibitions.title: Frederic Church, Winslow Homer & Thomas Moran: Tourism and the American Landscape

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, July 1844.
July 1844. Graphite on white wove paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-1385.
